Roles.Description: Has unlimited access to all management features and most data in all admin centers.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Global Administrator role to users who need global access to most management features and data across Microsoft online services. Giving too many users global access is a security risk and we recommend that you have between 2 and 4 Global Administrators.

Only Global admins can:

  • Reset passwords for all users including global admins
  • Add and manage domains

Note: The person who signed up for Microsoft online services automatically became a Global admin. You should evaluate if that person still requires this high level of permission.

Roles.Description: Manages Azure Active Directory B2B guest user invitations.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Guest Inviter role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage Azure AD Business-to-business (B2B) guest user invitations

Note: The Guest inviter role is only needed if the Members can invite users setting is set to No.

Roles.Description: Resets user passwords, creates and manages users and groups, including filters, manages service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Users who need to do the following actions:
  • Add users and groups
  • Assign licenses
  • Manage most user properties, except username
  • Create and manage user views
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Update password expiration policies
  • Monitor service health

Users who need to do the following actions for non-admin users and users assigned to the Directory reader, Guest inviter, Helpdesk admin, Message Center reader, or Reports reader roles:

  • Manage usernames
  • Delete and restore users
  • Reset passwords
  • Force users to sign out by invalidating refresh tokens
  • Update (FIDO) device keys

Important: User Administrators can change passwords for people who might have access to sensitive, private, or critical information. Changing the password of a user provides the potential to assume that user's identity and permissions.

Roles.Description: Resets passwords and re-authenticates for all non-admins and some admin roles, manages service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Helpdesk Administrator role to users who need to do the following actions only for non-admin users and users assigned the Directory Reader, Guest Inviter, Helpdesk Admin, Message Center Reader, or Reports Reader roles:
  • Reset passwords
  • Force users to sign out by invalidating refresh tokens
  • Create and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Important: Helpdesk admins can change passwords for people who might have access to sensitive, private, or critical information. Changing the password of a user provides the potential to assume that user's identity and permissions.

Roles.Description: Creates service requests for Azure, Microsoft 365, and Microsoft 365 services, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Service Support Administrator role as an additional role to admins or users whose role doesn't include the following, but still need to do the following:
  • Open and manage service requests
  • View and share Message center posts

Roles.Description: Makes purchases, manages subscriptions, manages service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Billing Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Purchase subscriptions and licenses
  • Upgrade to a new subscription
  • Pay for services
  • Receive email notifications for billing and invoices
  • Manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to Exchange Online, creates and manages groups, manages service requests, and monitors service health.Â
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Exchange Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage most admin features in the Exchange admin center
  • Manage mailboxes and anti-spam policies
  • View activity reports
  • Open and manage support tickets
  • Monitor service health

Note: This role doesn't give permission for Identity Protection Center or Privileged Identity Management.

Roles.Description: Full access to SharePoint Online, manages Microsoft 365 groups, manages service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the SharePoint Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in SharePoint online
  • Add and manage Microsoft 365 groups
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to all Teams and Skype features, Skype user attributes, manages service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Skype for Business Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all Microsoft Skype for Business features and access the Teams admin center
  • Manage Skype-specific user attributes in Azure Active Directory
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Important: The user account must also have a license that includes Microsoft Teams or the user can't run Teams PowerShell cmdlets.

Roles.Description: Manages regulatory requirements and eDiscovery cases, maintains data governance for locations, identities, and apps.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Compliance Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Help your organization stay compliant with any regulatory requirements
  • Manage eDiscovery cases
  • Maintain data governance policies across Microsoft online locations, identities, and apps

Roles.Description: Full access to enterprise applications, application registrations, and application proxy settings.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Application Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Create and manage enterprise application, registrations, and proxy settings, excluding Microsoft Graph and Azure AD Graph
  • Consent to delegated permissions and application permissions

Important: This role gives permission to impersonate an application's identity.

Roles.Description: Create application registrations and consent to app access on their own behalf.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Application Developer role to users who need to do the following:
  • Create application registrations when the Users can register applications setting is set to No
  • Consent on one's own behalf when the Users can consent to apps accessing company data on their behalf setting is set to No
  • Become owner when creating new application registrations or enterprise applications

Roles.Description: Read-only access to security features, sign-in reports, and audit logs.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Security Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • View security-related features in the Microsoft 365 Security center, Azure AD Identity Protection, Privileged Identity Management, but not edit any settings
  • View Azure AD sign-in reports and audit logs

Roles.Description: Controls organization's security, manages security policies, reviews security analytics and reports, monitors the threat landscape.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Security Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Control your organization's overall security
  • Create and manage security policies
  • Review security policies and reports
  • Monitor the threat landscape

Roles.Description: Manages role assignments and manages all access control features of Privileged Identity Management.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Privileged Role Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in Azure AD Privileged Identity Management
  • Manage role assignments in Azure AD

Important: This role gives permission to manage membership in all Azure AD roles including the Global admin role. Users assigned to this role can give themselves or others additional privilege by assigning additional roles.

Roles.Description: Full access to Intune, manages users and devices to associate policies, creates and manages groups.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Intune Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in Microsoft Intune
  • Manage users and devices to associate Intune policies
  • Create and manage groups

Roles.Description: Full access to enterprise applications and application registrations. No application proxy.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Cloud Application Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Create and manage enterprise applications and application registrations, but not application proxy settings
  • Consent to delegated permissions and application permissions, excluding Microsoft Graph and Azure AD Graph

Important: Users assigned this role aren't added as owners when creating new application registrations for enterprise applications. This role gives permission to impersonate an application's identity.

Roles.Description: Manages Customer Lockbox requests, can turn Customer Lockbox on or off.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Customer Lockbox Access Approver role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage Customer Lockbox requests for your organization
  • Turn the Customer Lockbox feature on or off
  • Approve and deny requests
  • Receive email notifications for requests

Roles.Description: Full access to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Online, manages service requests, monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Dynamics 365 Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in Microsoft 365 Dynamics Online
  • Manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to Microsoft Fabric management tasks, manages service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Fabric Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in Microsoft Fabric
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Manages Azure Active Directory conditional access settings, but not Exchange ActiveSync conditional access policy.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Conditional Access Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage Azure AD conditional access settings

Important: If this user needs to also manage Exchange ActiveSync conditional access, you should assign the Global admin role to this user.

Roles.Description: Reads usage reporting data from the reports dashboard, Power BI adoption content pack, sign-in reports, and Microsoft Graph reporting API.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Reports Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • View usage data and the activity reports in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Access to the Power BI adoption content pack
  • Access to sign-in reports and activity in Azure AD
  • View data returned by Microsoft Graph reporting API

Roles.Description: Reads and shares regular messages in Message Center, gets email notifications, has read-only access to users, groups, domains, and subscriptions.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Message Center Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • Monitor message center notifications
  • Get weekly email digests of Message Center posts and updates
  • Share message center posts
  • Have read-only access to Azure AD services, such as users and groups

Note: This role doesn't give permission to read data privacy messages. Only the Message Center privacy reader and the Global admin can read data privacy messages.

Roles.Description: Manages labels for the Azure Information Protection policy, manages protection templates, and activates protection.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Azure Information Protection Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in the Azure Information Protection service
  • Configure labels for Azure Information Protection policies
  • Manage protection templates and activate protection

Note: This role doesn't give permission for Identity Protection Center or Privileged Identity Management.

Roles.Description: Can access and manage Desktop management tools and services.
Roles.AdditionalDescription: Can access and manage Desktop management tools and services.

Roles.Description: Assigns and removes licenses from users and edits their usage location.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the License Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Add, remove and update licenses assigned to users
  • Add, remove and update licenses assigned to groups using group-based licensing
  • Edit usage location for users

Note: This role doesn't give permission to purchase or manage subscriptions, add or manage groups, or edit user properties, except for usage location.

Roles.Description: Enables, disables, and deletes devices and can read Windows 10 BitLocker keys.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Cloud Device Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Enable, disable, and delete devices in Azure AD
  • Read Windows 10 BitLocker keys

Roles.Description: Can require users to re-register authentication for non-password credentials, like MFA.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Authentication Administrator role to users who need to do the following for non-admins or users assigned the Authentication Administrator, Directory Readers, Guest Inviter, Message Center Reader, and Reports Reader roles:
  • Set or reset non-password credentials
  • Require users to use non-password credentials, such as Multi-factor authentication or FIDO
  • Revoke Remember MFA on the device which prompts for MFA the next time the users signs in

Roles.Description: Resets passwords, updates non-password credentials, forces users to sign out, monitors service health, and manages service requests.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Privileged Authentication Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Reset passwords for all non-admin users
  • View most settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Force users to sign out by invalidating refresh tokens
  • Update non-password authentication, like MFA, for all users including global admins
  • Monitor service health
  • Create and manage service requests
.

Roles.Description: Assigns telephone numbers, creates and manages voice and meeting policies, and reads call analytics.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Teams Communication Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage voice and telephony admin features in the Teams & Skype admin center
  • Assign telephone numbers
  • Create voice and meeting policies
  • Access all features of the call analytics toolset

Roles.Description: Reads call record details for all call participants to troubleshoot communication issues.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Teams Communication Support Engineer role to users who need to do the following:
  • Access the communication troubleshooting tools for Teams and Skype for Business
  • View full call records information for all call participants

Roles.Description: Reads user call details only for a specific user to troubleshoot communication issues.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Teams Communication Support Specialist role to users who need to do the following:
  • Access the communication troubleshooting tools for Teams and Skype for Business
  • Look up and view a specific user's details for a call, but can't view full call records

Roles.Description: Full access to Teams & Skype admin center, manages Microsoft 365 groups and service requests, and monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Teams Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features, including voice and telephony in the Teams & Skype admin center and Teams PowerShell modules
  • Add and manage Microsoft 365 groups
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to the Microsoft 365 Insights application, reads Azure AD properties, monitors service health, and manages service requests.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Insights Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all aspects of the Microsoft 365 Insights application
  • Read Azure Active Directory information
  • Monitor service health
  • Create and manage service requests

Roles.Description: Access to data privacy messages in Message Center, gets email notifications, has read-only access to users, groups, domains, and subscriptions.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Message Center Privacy Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • Permission to read all notifications in the Message Center, including data privacy messages
  • Get email notifications related to data privacy
  • Share message center posts
  • View groups, domains, and subscriptions
  • Open and manage service requests

Note: Only users assigned the Message Center privacy reader role or the Global admin role can read data privacy messages.

Roles.Description: Configure identity providers for use in direct federation.
Roles.AdditionalDescription: Assign the External Identity Provider Administrator role to users who need to configure identity providers for direct federation, including the Azure AD B2C service.

Roles.Description: Keeps track of data, makes sure it's protected, gets insights into issues, and helps mitigate risk.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Compliance Data Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Keep track of and protect your organization's data across Microsoft online locations
  • Get insights into issues to help mitigate risk

Roles.Description: Investigates and responds to security alerts, manages features in Identity Protection center, monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Security Operator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all features in the Identity Protection center, except for resetting passwords
  • View security-related features and policies in the Security center, Azure AD Identity Protection, Privileged Identity Management
  • View security reports and policies for role assignments
  • View Intune user, device, enrollment configuration, and application information
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to all Kaizala management features and data, manages service requests.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Kaizala Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features in Microsoft Kaizala
  • Add and manage users in Kaizala directory
  • Manage Kaizala groups
  • Manage action cards
  • Open and manage service requests

Roles.Description: Can view all administrative features and settings in all admin centers.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Global Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • View admin features and settings in all admin centers that the Global admin can view, but can't edit any settings

Roles.Description: Full access to Microsoft Search, assigns the Search Administrator and Search Editor roles, manages editorial content, monitors service health, and creates service requests.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Search Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features for Microsoft Search in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Assign the Search admin and Search editor roles to users
  • Add and manage search content, like bookmarks, Q&A items, and locations
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Can only create, edit, and delete content for Microsoft Search, like bookmarks, Q&A, and locations.
Roles.AdditionalDescription: Users in this role can create, manage, and delete content for Microsoft Search in the Microsoft 365 admin center, including bookmarks, Q&As, and locations.

Roles.Description: Resets passwords for all non-admin users and some admin roles.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Password Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Reset passwords for non-admin users and users assigned the Directory reader role, Guest inviter role, and other Password admins

Important: Password admins can change passwords for people who might have access to sensitive, private, or critical information. Changing the password of a user provides the potential to assume that user's identity and permissions.

Roles.Description: Manages network printers and connectors, configures printer access and preferences, manages print status and queues, and accepts admin consent permissions.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Printer Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Register and unregister printers
  • Configure printer access permissions
  • Set default printer preferences
  • View and manage printer status and print queues
  • Accept admin consent privileges on behalf of others in your org

Roles.Description: Can register and unregister printers and update printer status.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Printer Technician role to users who need to do the following:
  • Register and unregister printers
  • Update basic printer settings
  • Read all printer and connector properties

Roles.Description: Configures the authentication methods policy, organization-wide MFA settings, and password protection policies.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Authentication Policy Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Manage password protection policies including smart lockout configurations
  • Update the custom banned passwords list
  • Update the strong authentication property
  • Create and manage credential policies for users
  • Mange all aspects of verifiable credential contracts
  • Open and manage support tickets in Azure AD

Roles.Description: Creates and manages groups, including group naming and expiration policies, views activity and audit reports, monitors service health.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Groups Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Create and manage groups
  • Update group settings like the group naming policy and expiration policies
  • View groups usage activity and audit reports
  • Open and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to Microsoft Dynamics 365, PowerApps, data loss prevention policies, and Power Automate.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Power Platform Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage all admin features for Microsoft PowerApps, Power Automate (formerly known as Microsoft Flow), and data loss prevention
  • Create and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Full access to manage Azure AD Connect cloud provisioning.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Hybrid Identity Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage configurations to enable hybrid identity using Azure AD Connect cloud provisioning
  • View provisioning logs
  • Create and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Manages settings, policies, and deployment of Office apps.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Office Apps Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage deployment configurations and installation of Microsoft 365 apps
  • Create and manage policies in the Microsoft 365 apps admin center
  • Select, unselect, and publish "what's new" content for users to see in their Microsoft 365 apps, like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Create and manage service requests
  • Monitor service health

Note: This role gives access to the Microsoft 365 Apps admin center (http://config.office.com)

Roles.Description: Manage network locations and view network performance recommendations and insights.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign Network Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • View Network performance, including recommendations for perimeter infrastructure
  • Edit network locations and properties for each location

Roles.Description: Reads Microsoft 365 Insights application reports and insights.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Insights Business Leader role to users who need to do the following:
  • Read reports and insights in the Microsoft 365 Insights application

Roles.Description: Configure and manage devices used for Microsoft Teams services, like Teams Rooms, Teams displays, and phones.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Teams Device Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage devices and peripherals used for Teams services, like Teams Rooms, Teams displays, collaboration bars, and phones
  • Create and apply configuration profiles for devices
  • Manage and apply updates
  • Restart devices
  • View device and peripheral health status

Note: The Teams Device Administrator role doesn't provide access to call quality data or call analytics. To view call quality data or call analytics, you need to be assigned the Teams Communications Administrator role.

Roles.Description: Create and manage all aspects of attack simulation creation, launch and scheduling of a simulation, and the review of simulation results. Members of this role have this access for all simulations in the organization.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Attack Simulation Administrator role to users who need to do the following actions:
  • Create and manage all aspects of Attack Simulator
  • Create and manage attack simulation templates and attack payloads
  • Schedule and launch attack simulations
  • View reports of attack simulation campaigns, responses, and associated training

Roles.Description: Create attack payloads, but not launch or schedule them. Attack payloads are then available to all administrators who have permission to create an attack simulation.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Attack Payload Author role to users who need to do the following actions:
  • Create and manage attack simulation templates and attack payloads
  • View reports of attack simulation campaigns, responses, and associated training

Roles.Description: Reads Usage reports and Adoption Score, but can't access user details.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Usage Summary Reports Reader role to users who need to do the following:

  • View the Usage reports and Adoption Score
  • Read organizational insights, but not personally identifiable information (PII) of users

Note: This role only allows users to view organizational-level data with the following exceptions:

  • Member users can view user management data and settings.
  • Guest users assigned this role can not view user management data and settings.

Roles.Description: Can configure the knowledge network and content understanding.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Knowledge Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Create and manage topics and acronyms
  • Manage all standard properties in SharePoint
  • Create and delete all resources in SharePoint
  • Manage access to content through security groups
  • Update knowledge, learning and content understanding settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • View all standard settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • View all properties for sensitivity labels in the Compliance center
  • Create and manage support tickets in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Monitor service health

Note: This role also lets users create content centers in SharePoint, but users must also be assigned a license that includes Microsoft SharePoint Syntex.

Roles.Description: Creates and manages content and content centers, maintains the quality and structure of knowledge, and manages taxonomies for term store management.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Knowledge Manager role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Create and manage content, including topics and acronyms
  • Manage taxonomies as part of the term store management tool and create content centers
  • Manage access to content through security groups
  • Read analytics reports of knowledge, learning, and content understanding settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Manage all standard properties in SharePoint
  • Create and delete all resources in SharePoint
  • View all standard settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Create and manage support tickets in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Monitor service health

Roles.Description: Add and remove domain names for both on-premises and cloud deployments, and read and update all properties for domains.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Domain Name Administrator to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Add and remove domain names for on-premises and cloud deployments
  • Read and update all properties for domain names
  • Open and manage service requests in the Microsoft 365 admin center

Roles.Description: Defines, activates, and deactivates custom security attributes that can be assigned to objects such as users, devices, and service principals.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Attribute Definition Admin role to users who need to do the following:
  • Manage custom security attribute definitions
  • Manage attribute sets

Important: By default, Global Administrator and other administrator roles don't have permissions to read, define, or assign custom security attributes. To work with custom security attributes, a user must be assigned one of the custom security attribute roles: Attribute Assignment Administrator, Attribute Assignment Reader, Attribute Definition Admin, Attribute Definition Reader.

Roles.Description: Assigns and removes custom security attribute keys and values for objects such as users, devices, and service principals.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Attribute Assignment Administrator role to users who need to do the following:
  • Assign and remove custom security attributes in your organization

Important: By default, Global Administrator and other administrator roles don't have permissions to read, define, or assign custom security attributes. To work with custom security attributes, a user must be assigned one of the custom security attribute roles: Attribute Assignment Administrator, Attribute Assignment Reader, Attribute Definition Admin, Attribute Definition Reader.

Roles.Description: Reads the definitions of custom security attributes that can be assigned to objects such as users, devices, and service principals.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Attribute Definition Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • Read custom security attribute definitions in your organization

Important: By default, Global Administrator and other administrator roles don't have permissions to read, define, or assign custom security attributes. To work with custom security attributes, a user must be assigned one of the custom security attribute roles: Attribute Assignment Administrator, Attribute Assignment Reader, Attribute Definition Admin, Attribute Definition Reader.

Roles.Description: Reads custom security attribute keys and values for objects such as users, devices, and service principals.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Attribute Assignment Reader role to users who need to do the following:
  • Read custom security attributes in your organization

Important: By default, Global Administrator and other administrator roles don't have permissions to read, define, or assign custom security attributes. To work with custom security attributes, a user must be assigned one of the custom security attribute roles: Attribute Assignment Administrator, Attribute Assignment Reader, Attribute Definition Admin, Attribute Definition Reader.

Roles.Description: Manages all aspects of recipients, message tracking, and the migration of recipients to Exchange Online.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Exchange Recipient Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Performs all tasks in recipient management in Exchange Online
  • Manage taxonomies as part of the term store management tool and create content centers
  • Manages all aspects of message tracking in Exchange Online
  • Manages all tasks related to migrating recipients to Exchange Online

Roles.Description: Manages access to resources in Azure AD entitlement management
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Identity Governance Administrator to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Perform access reviews for guests and users
  • Create and delete resources associated with entitlement management
  • Update security group and Microsoft 365 group memberships
  • Update service principal role assignments

Roles.Description: Manages all aspects of Microsoft Cloud App Security
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Cloud App Security Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Manage all aspects of Microsoft Cloud App Security including create policies, update settings, upload logs, and perform governance actions
  • Views all properties and settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center

Roles.Description: Create and manage all aspects of Windows Update deployments through the Windows Update for Business deployment service
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Windows Update Administrator role to users who need to perform the following tasks:
  • Create Windows Update deployments
  • Manage Windows Update deployments and Windows Update Services

Roles.Description: Provision and manage all aspects of Cloud PCs.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Windows 365 Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Manage Windows 365 Cloud PCs in Microsoft Endpoint Manager
  • Enroll and manage devices in Azure AD, including assigning users and policies
  • Create and manage security groups, but not role-assignable groups
  • View basic properties in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Read usage reports in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Create and manage support tickets in Azure AD and the Microsoft 365 admin center

Roles.Description: Manage the site list for Internet Explorer mode in Microsoft Edge
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Edge Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Create, manage, and publish the enterprise site list, which is required for Internet Explorer (IE) mode on Microsoft Edge
  • Create and manage service requests in the Microsoft 365 admin center

Roles.Description: Manage all aspects of the Yammer service
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Yammer Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Manage all aspects of Yammer
  • Create, manage, and restore Microsoft 365 Groups, but not role-assignable groups
  • View the hidden members of Security groups and Microsoft 365 groups, including role assignable groups
  • Read usage reports in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Create and manage service requests in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • View announcements in the Message center, but not security announcements
  • View service health

Roles.Description: Customize sign in and sign up experiences for users by creating and managing custom authentication extensions.
Manage and share Virtual Visits information and metrics from admin centers or the Virtual Visits app.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Virtual Visits Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Manage and configure all aspects of Virtual Visits in Bookings in the Microsoft 365 admin center, and in the Teams EHR connector
  • View usage reports for Virtual Visits in the Teams admin center, Microsoft 365 admin center, and PowerBI
  • View features and settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center, but can't edit any settings

Roles.Description: Access the analytical capabilities in Microsoft Viva Insights and run custom queries.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Insights Analyst role to users who need to do the following:
  • Analyze data in the Microsoft Viva Insights app, but canât manage any configuration settings
  • Create, manage, and run queries
  • View basic settings and reports in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Create and manage service requests in the Microsoft 365 admin center

Roles.Description: Create and manage all aspects warranty claims and entitlements for Microsoft manufactured hardware, like Surface and HoloLens.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Microsoft Hardware Warranty Administrator role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Create new warranty claims for Microsoft manufactured hardware, like Surface and HoloLens
  • Search and read opened or closed warranty claims
  • Search and read warranty claims by serial number
  • Create, read, update, and delete shipping addresses
  • Read shipping status for open warranty claims
  • Create and manage service requests in the Microsoft 365 admin center
  • Read Message center announcements in the Microsoft 365 admin center
.

Roles.Description: Create and read warranty claims for Microsoft manufactured hardware, like Surface and HoloLens.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Microsoft Hardware Warranty Specialist role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Create new warranty claims for Microsoft manufactured hardware, like Surface and HoloLens
  • Read warranty claims that they created
  • Read and update existing shipping addresses
  • Read shipping status for open warranty claims they created
  • Create and manage service requests in the Microsoft 365 admin center
.

Roles.Description: Manage and configure all policies of Microsoft Viva Goals.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Users with this role can do the following tasks:
  • Manage and configure all aspects of the Microsoft Viva Goals application
  • Configure Microsoft Viva Goals admin settings
  • Read Azure AD tenant information
  • Monitor M365 service health
  • Create and manage Microsoft 365 service requests

Roles.Description: View product feedback, survey results, and reports to find training and communication opportunities.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the User Experience Success Manager role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Read organizational-level usage reports for Microsoft 365 apps and services, but not user details
  • View your organization's product feedback, Net Promoter Score (NPS) survey results, and help article views to identify communication and training opportunities
  • Read message center posts and service health data

Roles.Description: Write, publish, manage, and review the organizational messages for end-users through Microsoft product surfaces.
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Organizational Messages Writer role to users who need to do the following tasks:
  • Write, publish, and delete organizational messages using Microsoft 365 admin center or Microsoft Endpoint Manager
  • Manage organizational message delivery options using Microsoft 365 admin center or Microsoft Endpoint Manager
  • Read organizational message delivery results using Microsoft 365 admin center or Microsoft Endpoint Manager
  • Enable or disable permission options for organizational messages using Microsoft 365 admin center or Microsoft Endpoint Manager
  • View usage reports and most settings in the Microsoft 365 admin center, but can't make changes
.

Roles.Description: Can manage all settings for Microsoft Viva Pulse app
Roles.AdditionalDescription:
Assign the Viva Pulse Administrator role to users who need to manage settings within Microsoft Viva Pulse, such as:
  • Set minimum response threshold values.
  • Let users share reports with other users.
  • Customize Viva Pulse requests.
  • Delete an employeeâs Viva Pulse requests and responses upon receiving data subject requests (DSR), and view deletion history.
